timeline_html:
Here’s what I’m seeing: Your shedding began about 4 months before this check‑in (around May 2025). You described it as coming in waves, which makes sense when several triggers overlap.

Main triggers:

  • ⚡ Chronic illness flare starting Feb 2025 (still ongoing)
  • 💊 Medication change from Mar–May 2025 (still active/ongoing)
  • 💔 Major emotional stress (date not provided, but within the past 6 months)

Illness and medication changes usually cause fallout to spike about 2–4 months later, while emotional stress lands in a similar window. That’s why your heaviest shedding likely showed up between May–Jul 2025.

Where you are now: Because the chronic illness flare is still active, shedding hasn’t fully stabilized. You’re in the stabilization phase—not getting worse, but not yet at regrowth either.

Looking ahead ⏳: Once your flare eases, shedding should calm within 1–2 months. New baby hairs usually appear about 6–8 weeks later 🌱. This points toward visible regrowth signs in late 2025 or early 2026.

It may feel slow, but your follicles are strong and waiting for the all‑clear to regrow. You’re not alone in this, and every step you take now helps set up that recovery. ❤️
